definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: I want to have an all-electric vehicle in my lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 我想要在我的生活中有一個全電氣化的車。

sentences.english: Some have been electrified, but this is not common.
sentences.chinese: 有些房子已電氣化了，但是這種房子還不多見。

sentences.english: We have provided the electric ceramics to 35% of the country's electrified railways.
sentences.chinese: 全國35%的鐵路電氣化用電瓷都由我廠提供。

sentences.english: Gaomi is a " electrization city in countryside" named by the state Electric Power Ministry.
sentences.chinese: 高密是國家電力部命名的“農村電氣化市”。
普通電池是電氣化的細胞。

sentences.english: Don't use electric appliances for a while.
sentences.chinese: 暫時不要使用電氣化用品。

sentences.english: The applications of electricity have grown to the extent where most of us lead ‘electrified’ lives.
sentences.chinese: 電的應用已發展到可使大多數人享受電氣化的生活。

sentences.english: He needs money to electrify his surface lines.
sentences.chinese: 他需要錢把他的地面鐵路電氣化。

sentences.english: Mr Fermon said his report had electrified clients on both sides of the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 費爾蒙先生說，他的報告電氣化對大西洋兩岸的客戶。

sentences.english: The power failure took a toll on two traction substations along the Yingtan-Xiamen electric railway.
sentences.chinese: 停電影響鷹廈電氣化鐵路2個牽引變電站。

sentences.english: In the futureit will be fully electrified and mechanised.
sentences.chinese: 未來一切將完全實現電氣化和機械化。

sentences.english: The articulated neutral section insulator will be preferntial choice in the high-speed electrified railway in chine.
sentences.chinese: 關節式電分相將成爲我國高速電氣化鐵路的首選型式。
